alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 9:09PM CDT until June 12 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Concho and McCulloch. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 906 PM CDT, Storms have moved southeast into Mason County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. 1 to 3 inches of rain have fallen from east of Millersview to Doole...Melvin...Brady and Melvin. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brady, Lohn, Pear Valley, Brady Lake, Salt Gap, Doole and Rochelle. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... South Blackburn between Adkins and 13th, White Street at Live Oak Creek, Hallum Draw, FM 0503 crossing Waloope Creek, 17th Street between Pine and College, South High between 14th and 15th Streets, FM 1121 crossing Onion Creek, County Road 158 crossing Bowtie Creek, crossings along County Road 158 and County Road 156 crossing Bowtie Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
